course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Construction Law and Contract Administration
course.description: The course covers legal and contractual issues that may affect practicing engineers in their planning, design, construction and management of engineering projects.  Topics include general principles of common and civil legal systems, the Hong Kong legal environment, contract laws, tort laws, company laws, laws on evidence and the building laws.  The course also covers topics such as conflict of laws and international commercial arbitrations, engineers acting as expert witness in court and arbitral tribunals.

reviews.author: civil guy
reviews.comment_content:
The content is about different kinds of contracts, but only NEC appeared in the final exam.


Reading materials will be given every week. They will not be tested in the exam. Most students just ignored them
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Prof is passionate but his tone is too boring. Students kept skipping lessons. Prof. did lucky draws at the end of every lesson to encourage students not to skip classes. The prize are usually food or wine, cost more than HKD100.

Prof held an optional tour to CUHK Law Library on a weekend. Not many students joined. This made Prof. very sad.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair enough. It depends on your English writing skills
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely light
There are no homework
A midterm (30 min) - only rewrite Latham's principles (totally 13 principles) in your own words.
There is only One essay (1000 words) - to summarize a law case (you choose yourself) related to a contract.
One final exam - 2 essay questions, open books and notes, only include NEC, nothing to memorize
